#Text=York
#Text=York is an ancient cathedral city with a history that dates back to before Roman times .
#Text=It is situated in Yorkshire , North Yorkshire , England with some of the best preserved historical buildings and structures in Europe .
#Text=As of the 2001 census , the population of York was 181,000 .
#Text=York is frequently ranked ( often vying with Manchester ) the second most visited city in England after London .
#Text=York Minster
#Text=Understand
#Text=York was known as Eboracum by the Romans , who founded the fortress city on the River Ouse in the year 71 .
#Text=York was home first to the Ninth Legion and later the Sixth .
#Text=York quickly became one of the most important cities in Roman Britain , and after 211 became the capital of the province Britannia Inferior .
#Text=Constantine the Great - later responsible for making Christianity the official religion of the Roman Empire - was first proclaimed Emperor in the city .

#Text=Captured by the Vikings 866 , the city quickly took on a new identity as Jorvik ( pronounced " Visit your Thai travel agent to understand the Thai culture . Ensure respect for Thai customs . Be sure to dress appropriately . Wear comfortable shoes . Dress modestly . Dress for a Buddhist monk . Deflect any unwanted attention to a Buddhist monk . Avoid giving money to a monk .

#Text=York is known as England 's  City of Festivals " as there are regular cultural festivals every year .

column1: #Text=The official festivals are the Viking Festival , the Festival of Angels , Early Music , Late Music , Horse Racing ( the " Ebor Race Meeting " ) , Multicultural Food and Arts , Chinese New Year , Mystery Plays , Christmas St Nicholas ' Fair , and the Food and Drink Festival .
#Text=It 's a romantic city for a weekend break .
#Text=York is full of magic and a wonderful place to bring children !
#Text=Get in
#Text=Most travellers will arrive in York by road ( car or bus ) or rail from other parts of the UK or an airport .
#Text=By car
#Text=Although York is not directly on any of the main north - south motorways , the connections are reasonably good .

#Text=From the south , the quickest route is probably to take the M1 northbound to junction 32 , then the M18 eastbound to junction 2 , the A1M northbound to junction 44 and finally the A64 eastbound to the York Outer Ring Road ( A1237 ) .
#Text=Alternatively , you can take the M1 all the way to the A64 , but the upper reaches of the M1 around Sheffield and Leeds can get very congested , especially in the rush hours .

#Text=From the west , the A59 and the M62 provide connections from Liverpool and Manchester , and from the north the A1 and the A19 link York with Tyneside , Northumberland and south - eastern Scotland .
#Text=Driving into the city centre itself is something to avoid .

#Text=Traffic congestion on the main arterial roads serving the city ( especially the A19 on Bootham and the Inner Ring Road ) can get very bad , especially during the rush hours and on Saturday mornings .
#Text=The remodelling of some roads near bottleneck junctions to accommodate bicycle lanes has made traffic jams even worse still in recent years , and parking in the city centre is very expensive .

#Text=If you are just visiting York for the day , using a Park and Ride [ 1 ] costs a lot less than trying to park in or near the city centre , and there are five sites dotted around the Outer Ring Road .
#Text=However , the last buses from the city centre leave at around 8 pm in the evenings and you are not allowed to leave your car in a Park and Ride overnight .
#Text=Therefore , if you are staying overnight in York and arriving by car , make sure that your hotel offers parking before you book .
#Text=If you are only visiting for the day but staying until late evening , you will need to use a city centre car park .
